intro: Oxyanthus stenocarpus, commonly known as the narrow-fruited oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, elongated fruits. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
